Material from the Michigan Terminal System Dist-v4-26 June 2011 DVD submitted by Mike Alexander and available at the Bentley Historical Library (Ann Arbor)

Michigan Terminal System tapes and documentation for regular and partial distributions D1-0 through D6-0. Dates for the distributions span from October 1968 to April 1988. This group of files also includes the Michigan Terminal System distribution labeled tape program (lbltp). Refer to the README.txt file for important information about the distribution files.

Michigan Terminal System - Distribution Documentation and Files

mets:FLocat.xlink:label: Notes for Michigan Terminal System (MTS) full distributions D1-0, D2-0, D3-0, D4-0, D5-0, and D6-0; partial distributions D2-1, D2-2, D2-3, D3-1, D3-2, D4-1, D4-2, D4-3, and D5-1; and redistributions D4-2a and D4-2b (1968-1988).

Michigan Terminal System (MTS) distribution labeled tape (lbltp) program - source, binary, and documentation for a program that reads and decodes simulated tapes including MTS *FS format tapes for use under Windows, Mac OS, and Unix
Michigan Terminal System (MTS) Distribution 2-0 (February 1970) including one filesave and three distribution simulated tapes (aws), a
Michigan Terminal System (MTS) Distribution 2-0 (February 1970) including one filesave and three distribution simulated tapes (aws), a

Michigan Terminal System (MTS) Distribution 3-0 (August 1973) including five *FS distribution simulated and one dump/restore simulated tapes (aws), a distribution driver file, a distribution driver file listing, distribution notes, existing system installation instructions, a COPYRIGHT.txt file and a README.txt file. D3.0 supports the S/360-67. Partial Distribution 3-1 including one distribution simulated tape, a distribution driver file, a distribution driver file listing, and a log file. Partial Distribution 3-2 including two distribution tapes, a distribution driver file, a distribution driver file listing, and a log file.

Michigan Terminal System (MTS) Distribution 4-0 (August 1977) including three *FS distribution simulated tapes (aws), a distribution driver file, a distribution driver file listing, a distribution index file, distribution notes, new system installation instructions, existing system installation instructions, a list and subject index of Computing Center memos, a log file, a COPYRIGHT.txt file, and a README.txt file. D4.0 was the first full distribution to support the S/370 architecture. Partial Distribution 4-1 including one *FS distribution simulated and one dump/restore simulated tape, a data file, a description file, a program file, a change form file, a distributed driver file, a distribution index file, a distributed driver file listing, new system installation instructions, existing system installation instructions, distribution notes, and a log file. Partial Distribution 4-2 including two distribution simulated tapes (aws), a data file, a program file, a change form file, a distributed driver file, a distribution index file, a distibuted driver file listing, a memo file, new system installation notes, existing system installation notes, distribution notes, and a log file. Partial Distribution 4-3 including two distribution simulated tapes (aws), a distribution data file, a distribution change form file, a distribution driver file, a distribution index file, a distribution driver file list, a distribution memo file, new system installation instructions, existing system installation instructions, a notes file, and a log file. Redistribution 4-2A including two distribution simulated tapes (aws), a distribution driver file, a distribution driver file listing, six contributions files, and a log file. Redistribution 4-2B including one distribution simulated tape (aws), a distrbution driver file, a distribution driver file listing, and a log file.

Michigan Terminal System (MTS) Distribution 5-0 (April 1981) including four *FS distribution simulated tapes (aws), a distribution driver file, a distribution driver file listing, a distribution index file, distribution notes, new system installation instructions, existing system installation instructions, a list and subject index of Computing Center memos, four files with information from

Michigan Terminal System (MTS) Distribution 6-0 (April 1988) including six *FS distribution, three dump/restore, and one utility simulated tapes (aws), a distribution driver file, a distribution driver file listing, a distribution index file, a short description of MTS, distribution notes, new system installation instructions, existing system installation instructions, a log file, a COPYRIGHT.txt file, and a README.txt file.
